page.title: 04HOUSING IN LAINDON
page.content: On several new estates in Laindon, houses are{subsiding.}This is causing great problems. The houses have to be {underpinned}and this is costing {Basildon Development Corporation}a lot of money. The subsidence is caused by {London clay. Some people complain that the rates and rents of Laindon houses are too high. They say that gardens are too small and the area is too built up. Most houses in Laindon have been built by{Basildon Council and Basildon {Development Corporation.}There is some private housing and a few of the original{"plotland"}bungalows remain. These bungalows have been left to remind us of the early settlers. They came from{London's}grim{East End}to settle in Laindon's lovely countryside.
